availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Son of Haiden Trigg Sr. and Martha Gatewood Trigg. Married Mary Frances Martin Trigg. Father of Eliza Trigg, Haiden Trigg, Alanson C. Grigg, William F. Trigg, John M. Trigg, Turk Trigg, and Thomas H.Trigg. Resident of Barren County, Kentucky, in 1840. Owned twenty-four enslaved persons in Barren County, Kentucky, in 1840. Farmer in Barren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned thirty-four enslaved persons in Barren County in 1850. Farmer in Barren County in 1860. Owned thirty-three enslaved persons in Barren County in 1860.
